Michael McCrann wrote:

>It seems to me that it is quite hard to test MDB's as they are
>asyncronous. Has anyone got any stratagies for unit testing them? Or
>possibly, do you think that they shouldn't be unit tested at all, only
>tested at the functional/system testing level.
>
>  
>

I prefer to design an MDB to be merely a shell that accepts a message, 
cracks it, puts the information in a light-weight business object, then 
delegates to some request handler.  Therefore, the communication layer 
and the business logic layer can vary independently. Indeed, I might 
create a synchronous client (e.g. session bean) that uses the same 
business logic encapsulated in the request handler. Coincidentally, that 
makes it easier to unit test the business logic.

I might also write a system test that actually uses JMS.

Mike
